data.title: Preparing Creatives for the GenAI Generation
data.meta_description: Billy Seabrook, global chief design officer at IBM iX, discusses how to build a future-proof design team that embraces designer's talents in the age of GenAI.
data.text:
As generative AI tools begin to appear in enterprise workflows, creatives need guidance, support, and opportunities to build new skills to succeed. Join Billy Seabrook, global chief design officer at IBM iX, to get practical advice on building a future-proof design team where designers’ talents are central to business success. Get a preview of IBM’s upcoming study on the role of AI in the workplace, and hear how this new data can support a thriving design organization where creatives and leaders are prepared to excel in the changing creative landscape.

You’ll learn:

Which skills to develop to be a successful designer in the age of GenAI

How IBM uses DesignOps to support emerging tech, career growth, and designer productivity — while fighting creative burnout

How to steer confidently through a changing technology landscape, while continuing to deliver high-performing creative work

This content is copyrighted by Adobe Inc. Any recording and posting of this content is strictly prohibited.

By accessing resources linked on this page ("Session Resources"), you agree that 1. Resources are Sample Files per our Terms of Use and 2. you will use Session Resources solely as directed by the applicable speaker.

Billy has spent over 25 years creating innovative digital strategies and customer experiences for leading brands around the world. As the Global Chief Design Officer of IBM iX, he leads a team of over 7,000 experience consultants, multi-disciplinary designers, and developers to deliver data-driven insights, human-centric ideas, and measurable business impact for clients. Prior to joining IBM, he held executive creative leadership roles at Digitas, eBay, and Citi where he managed the growth and change of the organizations and the day-to-day activities of global creative teams.
